items.name: Advanced Pistol
items.description: The Advanced Pistol is the most advancedTier 4handgun with the largest ammo capacity, durability and rate of fire. It firesPistol Ammunitionsuch asArmor Piercing,Explosive,Incendiary,Obsidianor regular9mm Rounds.

items.name: Anti-materiel Rifle
items.description: The Anti-materiel Rifle is a bolt-action, anti-materiel rifle with a long effective range and an included scope for viewing the target. It firesSniper Ammunitionpurchased from theWorkshop.

items.name: Assault Rifle
items.description: The Assault Rifle is an automatic firearm with reduced critical damage, +15 round ammo capacity and a high rate of fire. It usesAssault Rifle Ammunitionsuch asArmor Piercing,Explosive,Incendiary,Obsidianor regular5.56mm Rounds.

items.name: Automated Defense System: Pistol
items.description: Automated Defense System: Pistol is a deployable base defense turret that firesPistol Ammunitionat hostileFauna.

items.name: Black Wolf Knife
items.description: The Black Wolf Knife is a knife with a 25% chance to inflict hemorrhage on targets and can be used as a tool to skin fauna. For the thrown variant of the Black Wolf Knife, viewBlack Wolf Throwing Knife.

items.name: Black Wolf Throwing Knife
items.description: The Black Wolf Throwing Knife is a variant of theBlack Wolf Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theBlack Wolf Knife, the Black Wolf Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Bolt Action Rifle
items.description: The Bolt Action Rifle is the first long-rangeFirearmthat prospectors can create. It can utilize the7.62mm Round, theIncendiary Rifle Round, etc. Along with theShotgun, it provides Prospectors with a significant increase in survivability when encountering theFaunaof Icarus. The Bolt Action Rifle can fire 75 rounds before breaking, and the talentGunsmithcan increase this to up to a maximum of 90 rounds, so bring aMachining Benchfor long trips.

items.name: Bone Knife
items.description: The Bone Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from theStone Knife, the Bone Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool.

items.name: Bone Spear
items.description: Spears increase the range to which Prospectors can attack fauna, providing a unique advantage when up high. The Bone Spear has twice as much health than theWood Spear, which can be the difference between winning and losing against Icarus' fauna. Unlike theBone Javelin, the Bone Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Bone Throwing Knife
items.description: The Bone Throwing Knife is a variant of theBone Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theBone Knife, the Bone Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: CHAC "Boomstick" Shotgun
items.description: The CHAC "Boomstick" Shotgun is an advanced purchaseableShotgunwith increase projectile and critical damage. It fires anyShotgun Ammunitionand is comparable to otherTier 4Firearms.

items.name: CHAC "Sentinel" Pistol
items.description: The CHAC "Sentinel" Pistol is an advanced handgun with increased projectile and critical damage that is comparable, or better than otherTier 4Firearms.

items.name: CHAC "Sovereign" Rifle
items.description: The CHAC "Sovereign" Rifle is a purchaseable rifle with a fast reload speed and moderate damage capability.

items.name: Carbon Spear
items.description: The Carbon Spear is an upgrade to thePlatinum Spearthat deals more damage and is cheaper to craft. Unlike theCarbon Javelin, the Carbon Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Caveworm Bow
items.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows, the Caveworm Bow is harder hitting than theLongbowand is equal in strength to theRecurve Bow.

items.name: Caveworm Knife
items.description: The Caveworm Knife is made with resources obtained fromCaveworms. Though the Caveworm Knife can be used as a melee weapon or tool to skin fauna, the Caveworm Knife has very little durability, which can prove problematic while on the go as it can only be repaired at anAnvil Bench.

items.name: Caveworm Spear
items.description: Spears increase the range to which Prospectors can attack fauna, providing a unique advantage when up high. Unlike theCaveworm Javelin, the Caveworm Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Caveworm Throwing Knife
items.description: The Caveworm Throwing Knife is a variant of theCaveworm Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theCaveworm Knife, the Caveworm Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Cold Steel Axe
items.description: The Cold Steel Axe is a mid/late-gameAxethat is introduced withChapter - New Frontier. The Cold Steel Axe can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

items.name: Cold Steel Knife
items.description: The Cold Steel Knife is a mid/late-gameKnifethat is introduced with the addition ofCold Steel Ingotson thePrometheusmap.

items.name: Cold Steel Pickaxe
items.description: The Cold Steel Pickaxe is a mid/late-gamePickaxethat was introduced withNew Frontiers.

items.name: Cold Steel Sledgehammer
items.description: Cold Steel Sledgehammer is aTier 3Sledgehammermade withCold Steel Ingots. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Cold Steel Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike theCold Steel Javelin, the Cold Steel Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Cold Steel Throwing Knife
items.description: The Cold Steel Throwing Knife is a variant of theCold Steel Knifethat can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching theCold Steel Knife. Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Combat Knife
items.description: While not particularly good for skinning a carcass, this knife excels in close quarters combat. Cannot be thrown.

items.name: Composite Spear
items.description: The Composite Spear is an upgrade to theTitanium Spearthat deals more damage and is cheaper to craft once Composites can be crafted. DespiteCompositesbeing a hefty tech investment, the Composite Spear has the highest damage output and durability outside ofPrometheusexclusive Spears. Unlike theComposite Javelin, the Composite Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Compound Bow
items.description: The tail-end of the 20th Century brought about many advancements in technology and archery didn't get left behind. A Compound Bow works like a simple block and tackle, multiplying input energy over distance with it's Cam and Idler Wheel pulleys, instead of traditional bow limbs; which allows the Compound Bow to hit harder than theRecurve Bow.

items.name: Crossbow
items.description: The earliest known Crossbows were invented on Earth in the first millennium BC, not later than the 7th century BC in ancient China, not later than the 1st century AD in Greece; on Icarus, Prospectors will test this ancient technology in many challenges to see if it still holds up.

items.name: Frag Grenade
items.description: An explosive weapon thrown by hand. Hold left click to charge a throw. The grenade timer starts when the grenade leaves your hand and will take a few seconds to detonate. Stacks up to 5.

items.name: Gunpowder
items.description: Gunpowder is a precursor resource used in makingAmmunition, weapons like theFrag Grenade, andVolatile Substance.

items.name: Hunting Rifle
items.description: The Hunting Rifle is a side-gate loading lever-action rifle, the apex of firearms on Icarus, and a significant upgrade in the long-range firepower available to the Prospector. Like its predecessor theBolt Action Rifle, it fires the7.62mm Round. It and theTrench Shotgunare effective game-changers in surviving theFaunaof Icarus. The Hunting Rifle can fire 100 rounds before breaking, and the talentGunsmithcan increase this to up to a maximum of 125 rounds, so bring aFabricatorfor long trips.

items.name: Inaris "Agua" Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Agua" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no WorkshopJavelins.

items.name: Inaris "Cerulean" Knife
items.description: The Inaris "Cerulean" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing frost damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Inaris "Cerulean" Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshopThrowing Knives.

items.name: Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe
items.description: The Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing fire damage to targets. Since the Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe has the same mining radius and yield as theLarkwell Martinez Pickaxe, Prospectors are better off using theInaris "Neves" Pickaxefor mining.

items.name: Inaris "Cobalt" Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Cobalt" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no WorkshopJavelins.

items.name: Inaris "Crimson" Knife
items.description: The Inaris "Crimson" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing fire damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. Despite what the flavor text says, the Inaris "Crimson" Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no workshopThrowing Knives.

items.name: Inaris "Dawn" Axe
items.description: The Inaris "Dawn" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing Fire damage to targets. Ideally used with theBerserkertalent, which increases axe melee damage.

items.name: Inaris "Dias" Axe
items.description: The Inaris "Dias" Axe is the Workshop equivalent of anSteel Axe, allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees. Unlike otherAxes, the Inaris "Dias" Axe is the only Axe that lowers the carry weight of wood by 50% when equipped, making it a valuable tool when transporting wood when paired with theGatherer's Backpack.

items.name: Inaris "Dusk" Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Dusk" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no WorkshopJavelins.

items.name: Inaris "Ersa" Axe
items.description: The Inaris "Ersa" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing Frost damage to targets. Ideally used with theBerserkertalent, which increases axe melee damage.

items.name: Inaris "Gris" Spear
items.description: The Inaris "Gris" Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

items.name: Inaris "Heavy" Crossbow
items.description: The Inaris "Heavy" Crossbow is the opposite of theInaris "Rapid" Crossbow, trading reload speed for a significant boost to overall damage. The Inaris "Heavy" Crossbow can use CrossbowBoltscrafted on planet as well asBoltscrafted in theWorkshop.

items.name: Inaris "Lune" Crossbow
items.description: The Inaris "Lune" Crossbow can use Crossbow Bolts crafted on planet as well as WorkshopBolts. Firing faster and dealing more damage than its predecessors, the Inaris "Lune" Crossbow, as a whole, is a must for avid Crossbow users.

items.name: Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe
items.description:
The Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aTitanium Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while greatly increasing yield.
Unlike other pickaxes, the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe is the only pickaxe that reduces the over-encumbrance penalty by 50% when equipped, which makes mobility while over-encumbered bearable when paired with the talentCarry OnandMass Dampener Modules.

items.name: Inaris "Night" Pickaxe
items.description: The Inaris "Night" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat and harvestingNoxious Crust. It deals poison damage to targets, a large amount of damage to armor, has a penalty for mining yield, but also produces Noxious Crust that can be cleaned to produce additionalMinerals.

items.name: Inaris "Rapid" Crossbow
items.description: The Inaris "Rapid" Crossbow is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Station. The Inaris "Rapid" Crossbow can use crossbow bolts crafted on planet as well as the bolts crafted in theWorkshop.

items.name: Inaris "Sali" Axe
items.description: The Inaris "Sali" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing poison damage to targets and generatingInfected Barkwhen harvesting trees.

items.name: Inaris "Shade" Knife
items.description: The Inaris "Shade" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing poison damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Inaris "Shade" Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshopThrowing Knives.

items.name: Inaris "Sole" Crossbow
items.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with other crossbows, the Inaris "Sole" Crossbow is geared more towards elemental damage. When paired withBoltsthat deal elemental damage (Obsidian Bolts,Larkwell Martinez Charged Bolts, etc), the Inaris "Sole" Crossbow can pack a punch, making it a decent, if not expensive, upgrade to the previous Workshop Crossbows. Dealt elemental damage is not affected by Crossbow talents.

items.name: Inaris "Ventura" Knife
items.description: Grants immunity to normal wounds while held, making it a useful tool when fighting severalwolvessimultaneously. Does not preventDeep Wounds. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Inaris "Ventura" Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

items.name: Inaris "Viridian" Pickaxe
items.description: The Inaris "Viridian" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing frost damage to targets.

items.name: Iron Axe
items.description: The Iron Axe is the 2nd axe you will unlock during your time on Icarus. It is located at the bottom of theTier 2tech tree, right after theAnvil Bench.

items.name: Iron Hammer
items.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

items.name: Iron Knife
items.description: The Iron Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from theBone Knife, the Iron Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. It is also the first knife capable of skinning larger fauna such as theGrizzly BearandBuffalo. An attachment slot is available, allowing for the application ofTool Attachment Packsat anAlteration Bench/Advanced Alteration Bench.

items.name: Iron Pickaxe
items.description: The Iron Pickaxe is the 2nd pickaxe prospectors can unlock during their time on Icarus. The blueprint is located at the bottom of the tier 2 tech tree and is considerably better than the previousStone Pickaxe, granting a 125% boost to mining efficiency. Like all iron tools, the iron pickaxe is repairable at anAnvil Bench.

items.name: Iron Sledgehammer
items.description: Iron Sledgehammer is aTier 2Sledgehammermade withIron.

items.name: Iron Spear
items.description: The Iron Spear is the firstSpearavailable to prospectors once they reach Tier 2 and serves as an upgrade to its Tier 1 counterparts. Unlike theIron Javelin, the Iron Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Iron Throwing Knife
items.description: The Iron Throwing Knife is a variant of theIron Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theIron Knife, the Iron Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Kinetic Rifle
items.description: The Kinetic Rifle is aLegendary WeaponRiflethat can be purchased at theBio-lab.

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Axe
items.description: The Larkwell Martinez Axe is the Workshop equivalent of anSteel Axe, allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees. Similar to theInaris "Dias" Axe, the Larkwell Martinez Axe also reduces the carry weight of wood when equipped.

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Compound Bow
items.description: The Larkwell Martinez Compound Bow is a stronger, more durable variant of theCompound Bowusing arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Hammer
items.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Knife
items.description: The Larkwell Martinez Knife is the hardest-hitting Workshop knife available. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Larkwell Martinez Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe
items.description: The Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aPlatinum Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield. Similar to theInaris "Neves" Pickaxe, the Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe reduces the over-encumbrance penalty by 10% when equipped.

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Spear
items.description: The Larkwell Martinez Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

items.name: Longbow
items.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with otherBows, the Longbow hits harder than theWood Bow.

items.name: MXC Axe
items.description: The MXC Axe is the Workshop equivalent of aStone Axe, providing a minor boost to felling damage and yield.

items.name: MXC Hammer
items.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

items.name: MXC Knife
items.description: The MXC Knife is equivalent toTier 2Tech like theIron Knife, giving Prospectors the ability to skin larger animals, such asBuffaloandGrizzly Bears. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the MXC Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

items.name: MXC Pickaxe
items.description: The MXC Pickaxe is the workshop equivalent of aStone Pickaxe, providing a minor boost to mining yield and efficiency.

items.name: MXC Spear
items.description: The MXC Spear is the firstSpearthat can be unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

items.name: Machete
items.description: The Machete is aToolthat can be used to skin Fauna and harvest Carrots, Wheat, shrubbery, etc. similar toSickles.

items.name: Miasmic Axe
items.description: Miasmic Axe is aTier 4Axemade withDistilled Miasmic Coatingderived fromCrystallized Miasmafound in theSwampsonPrometheus. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Miasmic Knife
items.description: Miasmic Knife is aTier 4Knifemade withDistilled Miasmic Coatingderived fromCrystallized Miasmafound in theSwampsonPrometheus. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Miasmic Pickaxe
items.description: Miasmic Pickaxe is aTier 4Pickaxemade withDistilled Miasmic Coatingderived fromCrystallized Miasmafound in theSwampsonPrometheus. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Miasmic Sledgehammer
items.description: Miasmic Sledgehammer is aTier 4Sledgehammermade withDistilled Miasmic Coatingderived fromCrystallized Miasmafound in theSwampsonPrometheus. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Miasmic Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike theMiasmic Javelin, the Miasmic Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Miasmic Throwing Knife
items.description: The Miasmic Throwing Knife is a variant of theMiasmic Knifethat can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching theMiasmic Knife. Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Obsidian Sledgehammer
items.description: Obsidian Sledgehammer is aTier 2Sledgehammermade withShaped Obsidian. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Obsidian Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike theObsidian Javelin, the Obsidian Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Obsidian Throwing Knife
items.description: The Obsidian Throwing Knife is a variant of theObsidian Knifethat can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching theObsidian Knife. Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: One-Shot Pistol
items.description: The One-Shot Pistol is an inexpensive early-gameTier 2handgun that holds one bullet.

items.name: Pistol
items.description: The Pistol is a single-shot 9mm handgun and is a decent upgrade in firepower available to prospectors. It fires 35 rounds ofPistol Ammunitionbefore breaking, so bring aMachining Bench/Repair Benchfor long trips.

items.name: Platinum Axe
items.description: The Platinum Axe is a mid/late-gameAxethat can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

items.name: Platinum Crossbow
items.description: The Platinum Crossbow is a mid/late game weapon that can penetrate hardened points with a chance to slow targets but has a slower fire rate thanBows.

items.name: Platinum Hammer
items.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

items.name: Platinum Knife
items.description: The Platinum Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from theSteel Knife, the Platinum Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. Unlike thePlatinum Throwing Knife, the Platinum Knife cannot be thrown.

items.name: Platinum Pickaxe
items.description: The Platinum Pickaxe is a mid/late-gamePickaxethat can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

items.name: Platinum Spear
items.description: The Platinum Spear is the firstSpearavailable to prospectors once they reach Tier 3 and serves as an, albeit expensive, upgrade to its Tier 2 counterparts. Unlike thePlatinum Javelin, the Platinum Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Platinum Throwing Knife
items.description: The Platinum Throwing Knife is a variant of thePlatinum Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike thePlatinum Knife, the Platinum Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Recurve Bow
items.description: The pinnacle of Instinctive Archery, made ofSteelandAluminium, the Recurve Bow hits harder than theLongbow.

items.name: Rusty Shotgun
items.description: A crude version of theShotgunthat fires slower and holds fewer rounds. It uses any type ofShotgun Ammunition.

items.name: Sandworm Bow
items.description: The Sandworm Bow is made with scales from theSandworm, using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

items.name: Sandworm Knife
items.description: The Sandworm Knife is made with scales obtained fromSandworms. Considering the Sandworm Knife deals the same amount of damage as aSteel Knife, the Sandworm Knife is overshadowed by higher-tier knives and is not worth the effort.

items.name: Sandworm Spear
items.description: The Sandworm Spear is made with scales fromSandwormsand can be used for melee combat with reach. Considering the Sandworm Spear deals the same amount of damage as aBone Spear, the Sandworm Spear is overshadowed by higher-tier spears and currently not worth the effort.

items.name: Sandworm Throwing Knife
items.description: The Sandworm Throwing Knife is a variant of theSandworm Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theSandworm Knife, the Sandworm Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Semi-Automatic Pistol
items.description: The Semi-Automatic Pistol is aTier 3handgun with more ammo capacity than thePistol. It fires pistolPistol Ammunitionsuch asArmor Piercing,Explosive,Incendiary,Obsidianor regular9mm Rounds.

items.name: Shengong "Akira" Hammer
items.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

items.name: Shengong "Daokou" Knife
items.description: The Shengong "Daokou" Knife is equivalent toTier 2Tech like theIron Knife, giving Prospectors the ability to skin larger animals, such asBuffaloandGrizzly Bears. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Shengong "Daokou" Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

items.name: Shengong "Dida" Spear
items.description: The Shengong "Dida" Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

items.name: Shengong "Dong" Pickaxe
items.description: The Shengong "Dong" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aSteel Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

items.name: Shengong "Gong Bu" Spear
items.description: The Shengong "Gong Bu" Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

items.name: Shengong "Heike" Axe
items.description: The Shengong "Heike" Axe is the Workshop equivalent of anIron Axe, allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees.

items.name: Shengong "Ji" Bow
items.description: The Shengong "Ji" Bow is a stronger, more durable variant of theRecurve Bowusing arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

items.name: Shengong "Jijing" Bow
items.description: The Shengong "Jijing" Bow is a stronger, more durable variant of theRecurve Bowusing arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

items.name: Shengong "Jiju" Spear
items.description: The Shengong "Jiju" Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

items.name: Shengong "Jushi" Pickaxe
items.description: The Shengong "Jushi" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aSteel Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

items.name: Shengong "Kuang" Pickaxe
items.description: The Shengong "Kuang" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aSteel Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

items.name: Shengong "Xingxing" Spear
items.description: The Shengong "Xingxing" Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

items.name: Shengong "Zhang Hu" Bow
items.description: The Shengong "Zhang Hu" Bow is a stronger, more durable variant of theRecurve Bowusing arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

items.name: Shengong 'Lie' Axe
items.description: The Shengong 'Lie' Axe is the Workshop equivalent of anIron Axe, allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees.

items.name: Shengong 'Qie' Knife
items.description: This knife and others, such as theShengong 'Sichou' Knife, with the additional attribute that gives increased skinning yield actually has a 230% Yield from Skinning. This is because the additional attribute is multiplicative and not additive, making them better than theTitanium KnifeorInaris "Ventura" Knifeat skinning. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Shengong 'Qie' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

items.name: Shengong 'Sen' Axe
items.description: The Shengong 'Sen' Axe is the Workshop equivalent of anIron Axe, allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees.

items.name: Shengong 'Shui' Knife
items.description: The Shengong 'Shui' Knife is equivalent toTier 2Tech like theIron Knife, giving Prospectors the ability to skin larger animals, such asBuffaloandGrizzly Bears. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Shengong 'Shui' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

items.name: Shengong 'Sichou' Knife
items.description: This knife and others, such as theShengong 'Qie' Knife, with the additional attribute that gives increased skinning yield actually has a 230% Yield from Skinning. This is because the additional attribute is multiplicative and not additive, making them better than theTitanium KnifeorInaris "Ventura" Knifeat skinning. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Shengong 'Sichou' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

items.name: Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe
items.description: The Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aSteel Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

items.name: Shengong 'Tetsuo' Hammer
items.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

items.name: Shengong CY7 Axe
items.description: The Shengong CY7 Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with the chance to significantly hinder targets. Ideally used with theBerserkertalent, which increases axe melee damage.

items.name: Shengong CZ4 Bow
items.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows, the Shengong CZ4 Bow is geared more towards elemental damage. When paired with arrows that deal elemental damage (Obsidian Arrows,Inaris "Netch" Arrows, etc), the Shengong CZ4 Bow can pack a punch, making it a decent, if not expensive, upgrade to the previous Shengong Bows. Dealt elemental damage is not affected by Bow talents.

items.name: Shengong DL7 Knife
items.description: The Shengong DL7 Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with a chance to significantly hinder targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Shengong DL7 Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshopThrowing Knives.

items.name: Shengong HS2 Bow
items.description: The Shengong HS2 Bow is a stronger variant of the Shengong Bows using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows. Despite the Shengong HS2 Bow dealing 35% less damage than theLarkwell Martinez Compound Bow, the Shengong HS2 Bow is unmatched in reload speed and fire rate; perfect for the Prospector who wants to fill the skies with arrows.

items.name: Shengong PF1 Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Shengong PF1 Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no WorkshopJavelins.

items.name: Shengong UT5 Pickaxe
items.description: The Shengong UT5 Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with the chance to significantly hinder targets. Since the Shengong UT5 Pickaxe has the same mining radius and yield as theLarkwell Martinez Pickaxe, Prospectors are better off using theInaris "Neves" Pickaxefor mining.

items.name: Shotgun
items.description: The Shotgun is one of the firstFirearmsavailable to prospectors. Using12-Gauge Buckshot Shellfor ammunition, the Shotgun is more powerful than theBolt Action Rifleat close range. However, damage decreases rapidly as range increases, and prospectors should not rely on it for long-range encounters with theFaunaof Icarus. The Shotgun can fire 100 rounds before breaking, and the talentGunsmithcan increase this to up to a maximum of 125 rounds, so bring aMachining Benchfor long trips.

items.name: Smoke Grenade
items.description: A smoke grenade is a canister-type grenade used as a signaling device, target or landing zone marking device, or as a screening device for unit movements. Upon detonation, the Smoke Grenade will cover the area in smoke and will obstruct the vision of creatures within the smoke. However, it will not stop creatures that are already aggressively pursuing Prospectors, creatures spawned by Thumpers, Radars, or other mission items that have been placed or activated. Stacks up to 5.

items.name: Steel Axe
items.description: The Steel Axe is a mid-gameToolavailable in Icarus. Prospectors can unlock it inTier 2of theTech Tree, after reaching Level 20.

items.name: Steel Hammer
items.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

items.name: Steel Knife
items.description: The Steel Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from theIron Knife, the Steel Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. An attachment slot is available, allowing for the application ofTool Attachment Packsat anAlteration Bench/Advanced Alteration Bench.

items.name: Steel Pickaxe
items.description: The Steel pickaxe is the 3rd pickaxe prospectors can unlock during your time on Icarus and allows for the mining of denserMineralsnot obtainable with theIron PickaxeorStone Pickaxe. Like iron tools, the steel pickaxe is made and is repairable at anAnvil Bench.

items.name: Steel Spear
items.description: The Steel Spear is an upgrade to theIron Spearthat deals more damage/critical damage to targets and has twice the durability. Unlike theSteel Javelin, the Steel Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Steel Throwing Knife
items.description: The Steel Throwing Knife is a variant of theSteel Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theSteel Knife, the Steel Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Stone Axe
items.description: The Stone Axe is used primarily for chopping down trees andSmall Trees, reducing them to usableWood. In the process of chopping apart fallen trees, a small number ofSticksmay be added to your inventory automatically.

items.name: Stone Knife
items.description: The first knife that can be unlocked, the Stone Knife is a fast melee weapon and doubles as a tool with any knife being necessary to skin a carcass prior to unlocking theSkinning Bench.

items.name: Stone Throwing Knife
items.description: The Stone Throwing Knife is a variant of theStone Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theStone Knife, the Stone Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of 5 and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Submachine Gun
items.description: The Submachine Gun is a compact firearm with low projectile and critical damage, but a high rate of fire. It usesPistol Ammunitionsuch asArmor Piercing,Explosive,Incendiary,Obsidianor regular9mm Rounds.

items.name: Tactical Bow
items.description: The Tactical Bow is an advanced bow that is part of theGreat Hunts CampaignsDLC onPrometheus. It fires any type ofArrowand can be upgraded in theBio-lab.

items.name: Taxidermy Knife
items.description: The Taxidermy Knife is used for skinningFaunacarcasses, when a prospector wishes to obtain aVestigefor mounting. Skinning any carcass with a taxidermy knife grants fourBestiarypoints for the animal skinned.

items.name: Titanium Axe
items.description: The Titanium Axe is the highest tieredAxethat can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

items.name: Titanium Crossbow
items.description: The Titanium Crossbow is an upgrade to the Platinum Crossbow that offers a boost to projectile damage and a slightly larger ammo count; has a chance to slow targets and can fully penetrate hardened points, but has a slower fire rate thanBows.

items.name: Titanium Hammer
items.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

items.name: Titanium Knife
items.description: The Titanium Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from thePlatinum Knife, the Titanium Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. Unlike theTitanium Throwing Knife, the Titanium Knife cannot be thrown.

items.name: Titanium Pickaxe
items.description: The Titanium Pickaxe is the highest-tieredPickaxethat can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus. When combined with aTool Attachment Pack/Advanced Tool Attachment Pack, the Titanium Pickaxe surpasses theInaris "Neves" Pickaxein terms of mining.

items.name: Titanium Spear
items.description: The Titanium Spear is the firstSpearavailable to prospectors once they reach Tier 4 and serves as an, albeit expensive, upgrade to its Tier 3 counterparts. Unlike theTitanium Javelin, the Titanium Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Titanium Throwing Knife
items.description: The Titanium Throwing Knife is a variant of theTitanium Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theTitanium Knife, the Titanium Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Tomato & Egg Bowl
items.description: Tomato & Egg Bowl is aFoodwith a uniqueStatus Effect, which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfyHunger.

items.name: Trench Shotgun
items.description: The Trench Shotgun is aTier 4variant of theShotgunthat packs a punch and currently is the highest damage dealing close-range weapon available. It uses any type ofShotgun Ammunition. With the highest ammo capacity and projectile damage amongst all three Shotguns, the Trench Shotgun is a go-to for the Shotgun enthusiast in the group. The Trench Shotgun can fire 100 rounds before breaking, and the talentGunsmithcan increase this to up to a maximum of 125 rounds, so bring aFabricatorfor long trips.

items.name: Wood Bow
items.description: The Wood Bow is the first bow a player can get access to. It can be unlocked via the Tech Tree inTier 1with no prerequisite tech required.

items.name: Wood Hammer
items.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

items.name: Wood Spear
items.description: The Wood Spear is the firstSpearavailable to prospectors and serves as an alternative to theStone Knife, dealing increased critical damage but with a slower attack speed. Like other spears, the Wood Spear increase the range to which prospectors can attack fauna, providing a unique advantage when up high.
